flashcards.english: People who are alive do not rest (People with life/spirit must keep working)
flashcards.notes: Proverb about continuous work and effort in life. Marĩ mũoyo = who have a soul/spirit (people who are alive). Hurũka = to rest, Kũhurũka = to rest (infinitive). Teaches that living requires constant effort

flashcards.english: The one being chased and the one chasing, both get tired (In any conflict, both parties suffer)
flashcards.notes: Proverb about mutual exhaustion in conflict. Shows agent/patient formation: Mũingatani (the chaser - active agent), Mũingatwo (the one being chased - patient). Kũingata = to chase away, Kũhũma = to be breathless. Pattern extends: Mũrutani/Mũrutwo (teacher/student), Mũhurani/Mũhurwo (beater/beaten)
